name: Altina 'AVEC FlowState' Non Alcoholic Mango Spritzer 750ml NV
description: With its easy mango juiciness and crisp citrussy finish, this non-alcoholic super wine is both plump and fresh in a juicy kind of way. We think it would be fantastic as a brunch wine, especially when served with salty bacon and creamy eggs, or with an open sandwich with cheese and crunchy salad. You could really pair this with just about anything really, although it's not a heavyweight wine so best to avoid very strong flavours. keyvalueFOODBrunch, saladTASTESFresh, SaltyMOODSCelebratory, CreativeSEASONSSpring, Summer RECIPE MATCHES Bacon and Egg SaladMango and Spicy Chickpea SaladChicken Stuffed with Goat’s Cheese

name: Dr Loosen 'Dr Lo' Alcohol Removed Sparkling NV
description: There is nothing but joyous fruit in this de-alcoholised German Riesling, which makes it an incredibly easy drink to pair with on the dinner/brunch/breakfast table. The breakfast part is important because bacon and eggs are an unlikely hero pairing, especially with the juicy, fresh fruit of this wine contrasting with the salty bacon. It's otherwise a fantastic brunch wine, especially with salads that incorporate richer sauces, fresh and zesty pasta and pasta salad, grilled seafood, salty noodles and rice based dishes that have a salty edge to them. keyvalueFOODPicnic, SaladsTASTESCrisp, DelicateMOODSAlways a Winner, RelaxedSEASONSAutumn, Spring, Summer RECIPE MATCHES Bacon and Egg SaladChirashi BowlCrispy Tofu Noodles

name: Heaps Normal 'Third IPA' India Pale Ale 375ml

name: Heaps Normal 'Half Day Hazy' Hazy Pale Ale 375ml
description: If you ever had any doubt that a non-alcoholic beer could hit all the high notes when it comes to flavour… this hazy brew from Heaps Normal is about to rock your world. Not only does it taste great and deliver no shortage of satisfaction, it’s a brilliant choice for food pairing, too. We loved it with breaded and fried fish, white meats and veggies, and found it worked especially well with meat-free burgers and ingredients like fried tofu and paneer. However, you’ll get equally good results with aged charcuterie, katsu curry and Hong Kong sweet and sour chicken or pork, as well as with strong cheeses and loaded fries or nachos. Who could possibly ask for more? keyvalueFOODChinese Noodles, Mac 'n' CheeseTASTESCreamy, SpicyMOODSRelaxed, CreativeSEASONSWarmer Months RECIPE MATCHES Chinese Crispy ChickenCauliflower Steak BurgerCheese and Bacon Loaded Fries

name: Midnight Mixers Pink Grapefruit Tonic 200ml
description: You have two choices with this Pink Grapfruit Tonic: a) use it chiefly as a mixer to help liven up a Mezcal, rum or other dark spirit b) drink it by itself and pair it with something delicious. Option a) makes you something like a grapefruit negroni (just add gin, vermouth and Campari) whereas b) commands you to pair it with a citrus based salad, honey soy chicken or anything with a sweet and sour contrast. keyvalueFOODAperitif, DigestifTASTESJuicy. TangyMOODSCelebratory, ExcitedSEASONSAll Year Round RECIPE MATCHES Grapefruit and Crispy Pork SaladSalmon and Citrus SaladLemon Pepper Chicken

name: Awesome Source 'Red Grape, Orange & Pepperberry' Non Alcoholic G & T 200ml
description: You'll want to drink this G & T well chilled to manage the sweetness/freshness balance, so this is well matched with plenty of ice and a little citrus (and we like it with a little mint). The more bolder flavours of this G & T will cut through roasted meats and poultry, with turkey, chicken and ham all surprise pairs that work a treat. We love it with an antipasto platter stacked with roasted veges, strong cheeses and plenty of cured meats. keyvalueFOODAntipasto, Roast TurkeyTASTESJuicy, SaltyMOODSMood for Something Different, RelaxedSEASONSSpring, Autumn RECIPE MATCHES Spicy Turkey RiceSmoked Ham WaldorfMediterranean Roasted Vegetable Traybake
